categories.label: SamSPECTRAL - basic
categories.info: Controls to specify parameters of the cluster analysis

input_columns.label: variable
input_columns.info: Columns selected to perform the analysis

input_normal_sigma.label: normal sigma
input_normal_sigma.info: A value specifying the resolution in the spectral clustering stage. By increasing it, more spectral clusters are identified. This can be useful when small population are aimed

input_separation_factor.label: separation factor
input_separation_factor.info: This threshold controls to what extend clusters should be combined or kept separate.Normally, an appropriate value will fall in range 0.3-2

input_scale.label: scale (ex: 1,1,1,...)
input_scale.info: A vector the length of which is equal to the number of dimensions. The coordinates in each dimension are multiplied by the corresponding scaling factor. So, the bigger this factor is for a dimension, SamSPECTRAL will consider that dimension to be more significant and consequently, that dimension will be more effective in clustering. By default, all columns are equally significant

input_precision.label: precision
input_precision.info: An integer determining the precision of computations. Setting it to 6 will work and increasing it does not improve results

categories.label: SamSPECTRAL - advanced
categories.info: Controls to specify parameters of the cluster analysis

is_number_of_clusters_NA.label: estimate number of spectral clusters
is_number_of_clusters_NA.info: If TRUE, the number of spectral clusters is automatically computed

input_number_of_clusters.label: number of clusters (if above unselected)
input_number_of_clusters.info: This integer is the number of spectral clusters

input_do_sampling.label: do sampling
input_do_sampling.info: If FALSE, the sampling stage will be ignored by picking up all the data points

input_beta.label: beta
input_beta.info: A parameter with default value which must NOT be changed except for huge samples with more than 100,000 data points or for developmental purposes. Setting beta to zero will reduce computational time by applying the following approximation to the conductance calculation step. For each two community, the conductance will be the conductance between their representatives times their sizes

input_stabilizer.label: stabilizer
input_stabilizer.info: The larger this integer is, the final results will be more stable. The underlying kmeans will restart many more times

is_k_for_kmeans_NA.label: estimate number of clusters for kmeans
is_k_for_kmeans_NA.info: If TRUE, automatic estimation number of clusters for running kmeans algorithm based on eigen values curve

input_k_for_kmeans.label: k for kmeans (if above unselected)
input_k_for_kmeans.info: The number of clusters for running kmeans algorithm in spectral clustering

input_m.label: m
input_m.info: An integer specifying upper and lower bounds on the final number of sample points. (range: 0.95*m/2 and 2 1.1*m)

is_min_eigenvalue_NA.label: don't associate the number of spectral clusters with eigenvalues
is_min_eigenvalue_NA.info: If TRUE, eigenvalues will not be used to determine the number of spectral clusters

input_min_eigenvalue.label: min eigenvalue (if above unselected)
input_min_eigenvalue.info: The number of spectral clusters is determined such that corresponding eigenvalues are larger than this threshold

input_minimum_degree.label: min degree
input_minimum_degree.info: If a node in the graph has total edge sum less than this threshold, it will be considered as an isolated community
